filmography.title: Dr. No
filmography.role_description: The first cinematic appearance of the suave, ruthless British secret agent 007, establishing the character's wit, sophistication, and lethality.
filmography.plot: A resourceful British government agent seeks answers in a case involving the disappearance of a colleague and the disruption of the American space program.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Win – Most Promising Newcomer (Sean Connery); AFI: 100 Years... 100 Movie Quotes (#22)

filmography.title: From Russia with Love
filmography.role_description: Bond returns as a harder-edged, cold warrior spy battling a criminal organization in a deadly game of cat-and-mouse aboard the Orient Express.
filmography.plot: James Bond willingly falls into an assassination plot involving a naive Russian beauty in order to retrieve a Soviet encryption device that was stolen by S.P.E.C.T.R.E.

filmography.title: Goldfinger
filmography.role_description: Connery defines the 'Bond' archetype in this quintessential entry, blending action, charm, and humor as he faces a gold-obsessed tycoon.
filmography.plot: While investigating a gold magnate's smuggling, James Bond uncovers a plot to contaminate the Fort Knox gold reserve.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Sound Effects; AFI: 100 Years... 100 Thrills (#71)

filmography.title: The Untouchables
filmography.role_description: A tough, streetwise Irish-American beat cop who becomes the mentor and moral compass for Eliot Ness in his war against Al Capone.
filmography.plot: After building a team of uncorruptible law enforcement agents, Federal Agent Eliot Ness sets out to take down Al Capone during Prohibition.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Supporting Actor; Golden Globe: Win – Best Supporting Actor; BAFTA: Nominated – Best Supporting Actor

filmography.title: Indiana Jones and the Last Crusade
filmography.role_description: The estranged, scholarly father of Indiana Jones, whose obsession with the Holy Grail draws them both into a Nazi plot.
filmography.plot: In 1938, after his father Professor Henry Jones, Sr. goes missing while pursuing the Holy Grail, Indiana Jones finds himself up against Adolf Hitler's Nazis again to stop them from obtaining its powers.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Nominated – Best Supporting Actor; BAFTA: Nominated – Best Supporting Actor

filmography.title: The Hunt for Red October
filmography.role_description: A stoic, highly respected Soviet submarine commander who plans to defect to the United States with a cutting-edge nuclear sub.
filmography.plot: In November 1984, the Soviet Union's best submarine captain in their newest sub violates orders and heads for the U.S. Is he trying to defect or to start a war?

filmography.title: The Man Who Would Be King
filmography.role_description: A charismatic, ambitious British soldier who, along with his comrade, travels to a remote land in Afghanistan to set himself up as a king and a god.
filmography.plot: Two former British soldiers in 1880s India decide to set themselves up as Kings in Kafiristan, a land where no white man has set foot since Alexander the Great.

filmography.title: The Name of the Rose
filmography.role_description: An intellectual Franciscan friar with Sherlock Holmes-like deductive skills who investigates a series of mysterious deaths in a medieval abbey.
filmography.plot: An intellectually nonconformist friar investigates a series of mysterious deaths in an isolated abbey.

filmography.title: The Hill
filmography.role_description: A defiant former Sergeant Major imprisoned in a brutal military detention camp for assaulting a superior officer, who challenges the sadistic authority of the guards.
filmography.plot: In a British military prison in North Africa during WWII, five new prisoners struggle to survive the brutality of the guards and the punishment of climbing a man-made hill.
filmography.awards: National Board of Review: Win – Best Supporting Actor (Harry Andrews, but film highly acclaimed)

filmography.title: Marnie
filmography.role_description: A wealthy widower who discovers his new employee is a thief but, intrigued by her psychological issues, blackmails her into marriage to 'cure' her.
filmography.plot: Mark Rutland marries Marnie, a thief and a liar, and tries to help her resolve her deep-seated psychological problems.

filmography.title: The Rock
filmography.role_description: The only man to ever escape Alcatraz, a highly trained British agent who has been imprisoned without trial for decades, recruited to break back into the prison.
filmography.plot: A mild-mannered chemist and an ex-con must lead the counterstrike when a rogue group of military men, led by a renegade general, threaten a nerve gas attack from Alcatraz against San Francisco.
filmography.awards: MTV Movie Award: Win – Best On-Screen Duo (with Nicolas Cage)

filmography.title: Time Bandits
filmography.role_description: A warm, heroic portrayal of the legendary Greek king who becomes a father figure to the young protagonist during his time-traveling adventures.
filmography.plot: A young boy accidentally joins a band of time travelling dwarves as they jump from era to era looking for treasure to steal.

filmography.title: Murder on the Orient Express
filmography.role_description: A rigid, protective British army officer traveling from India who becomes a suspect in the murder investigation aboard the famous train.
filmography.plot: In December 1935, when his train is stopped by deep snow, detective Hercule Poirot is called on to solve a murder that occurred in his car the night before.
filmography.awards: BAFTA: Nominated – Best Supporting Actor (Film won 3 BAFTAs)

filmography.title: A Bridge Too Far
filmography.role_description: The commander of the British 1st Airborne Division, who finds himself and his men trapped and outgunned in Arnhem during Operation Market Garden.
filmography.plot: Operation Market Garden, September 1944: The Allies attempt to capture several strategically important bridges in the Netherlands in the hope of breaking the German lines.
filmography.awards: BAFTA: Win – Best Supporting Actor (Edward Fox won, Connery part of ensemble)

filmography.title: Thunderball
filmography.role_description: Bond heads to the Bahamas to recover two stolen nuclear warheads, featuring extensive underwater combat sequences.
filmography.plot: James Bond heads to the Bahamas to recover two nuclear warheads stolen by S.P.E.C.T.R.E. Agent Emilio Largo in an international extortion scheme.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Special Visual Effects

filmography.title: You Only Live Twice
filmography.role_description: Bond travels to Japan to investigate spacecraft hijackings, eventually confronting Blofeld in his volcano lair.
filmography.plot: Agent 007 and the Japanese secret service ninja force must find and stop the true culprit of a series of space hijackings before war is provoked between Russia and the United States.

filmography.title: Robin and Marian
filmography.role_description: An aging, war-weary Robin Hood returns from the Crusades to woo Maid Marian, now an abbess, and fight his old nemesis one last time.
filmography.plot: Robin Hood, aging and none too wise, returns from the Crusades to woo and win Maid Marian one last time.

filmography.title: The Wind and the Lion
filmography.role_description: A charismatic Berber chieftain who kidnaps an American woman and her children, sparking an international incident with Teddy Roosevelt.
filmography.plot: In early 20th century Morocco, a Berber chieftain triggers an international incident by kidnapping an American widow and her children.

filmography.title: Finding Forrester
filmography.role_description: A reclusive, J.D. Salinger-esque author who becomes an unlikely mentor to a gifted young writer and basketball player from the Bronx.
filmography.plot: A young writing prodigy finds a mentor in a reclusive author who wrote one highly acclaimed novel decades ago and then vanished from the public eye.

filmography.title: Highlander
filmography.role_description: An immortal Egyptian (formerly Spanish) swordsman who mentors the protagonist Connor MacLeod in the ways of the Immortals.
filmography.plot: An immortal Scottish swordsman must confront the last of his immortal opponent, a murderously brutal barbarian who lusts for the fabled 'Prize'.

filmography.title: The Offence
filmography.role_description: A burnt-out police detective who snaps during the interrogation of a suspected child molester, revealing his own dark psychological state.
filmography.plot: A police detective kills a suspected child molester while questioning him, and in the ensuing investigation, his own dark side is revealed.
filmography.awards: BAFTA: Nominated – Best Supporting Actor (Ian Bannen)

filmography.title: Zardoz
filmography.role_description: A barbaric 'Exterminator' in a post-apocalyptic future who invades the sanctuary of the immortal elite to discover the truth about his god.
filmography.plot: In the distant future, a savage trained only to kill finds a way into the community of bored immortals that alone preserves humanity's achievements.

filmography.title: Entrapment
filmography.role_description: A legendary master thief who is tracked by an insurance investigator, only to team up with her for a massive heist.
filmography.plot: An insurance agent is sent by her employer to track down and help capture an art thief.
filmography.awards: European Film Awards: Win – Best Actor (Audience Award)

filmography.title: Diamonds Are Forever
filmography.role_description: Connery returns as Bond to investigate a diamond smuggling ring that leads him to Las Vegas and another confrontation with Blofeld.
filmography.plot: A diamond smuggling investigation leads James Bond to Las Vegas, where he uncovers an extortion plot headed by his old nemesis, Blofeld.

filmography.title: Never Say Never Again
filmography.role_description: An aging Bond returns to active duty in this non-official entry to stop SPECTRE from detonating stolen nuclear warheads.
filmography.plot: A S.P.E.C.T.R.E. agent has stolen two American nuclear warheads, and James Bond is the only one who can stop him.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Nominated – Best Supporting Actress (Barbara Carrera)

filmography.title: Outland
filmography.role_description: A federal marshal stationed at a mining colony on Jupiter's moon Io uncovers a drug-smuggling conspiracy and must face the corrupt administration alone.
filmography.plot: In the distant future, a police marshal stationed at a remote mining colony on Jupiter's moon Io uncovers a drug-smuggling conspiracy, and gets no help from the populace when he later finds himself marked for murder.

filmography.title: The Russia House
filmography.role_description: A boozy, jazz-loving British publisher who is recruited by intelligence agencies to investigate a potential Soviet defector and falls for a Russian woman.
filmography.plot: An expatriate British publisher is recruited by the Secret Service to investigate three notebooks believed to contain Russian military secrets.
filmography.awards: Berlin International Film Festival: Nominated – Golden Bear
